newsitem.title: MEXICO: Ban on government propaganda overturned in Mexico.
newsitem.headline: Ban on government propaganda overturned in Mexico.

text.p: The Federal Electoral Tribunal overturned a move by the Federal Electoral Institute, which oversees voting in Mexico, to ban government propaganda 30 days before an election, newspapers reported on Saturday.
The court was acting on a complaint by the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party, which is facing stiff competition in the races before mid-term elections July 6.
The tribunal said the electoral institute went beyond its jurisdiction by trying to ban the government advertising, newspaper Uno Mas Uno reported.
The institute reached an agreement in March with federal, state and municipal governments that would have stopped them using political ads one month before elections.
The tribunal also overturned the institute's decision to set up a commission to investigate voting irregularities, newspapers reported.
